<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_BSP_ExecTput:
```c
static void OS_BSP_ExecTput(const char *cap, const char *param)
{
    pid_t cpid;
    int   status;

    cpid = fork();
    if (cpid < 0)
    {
        return;
    }
    if (cpid == 0)
    {
        execlp("tput", "tput", cap, param, NULL);
        exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
    }
    waitpid(cpid, &status, 0);
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (cpid == 0)
    {
        execlp("tput", "tput", cap, param, NULL);
        exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
    }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The call to exit(EXIT_FAILURE) is executed only if execlp returns (i.e. if execlp fails). execlp normally does not return on success because it replaces the process image, but it may fail and return - in that case the exit call is reachable. Therefore there is no unreachable code in this fragment.
